entry.title: base::features::Init not invoked in child processes
entry.content:
The behavior of base feature initialization changed with https://chromiumdash.appspot.com/commit/5e9ab02b335aa84e468f0b23d5c9f9f56cd694bb
Expected behavior: `base::features::Init` is called on all processes. This is important because the function initializes file-scope variables and one copy of those lives in each process.
Actual behavior: The function is only called in the Browser process.
This can be validate by adding a `base::debug::Stacktrace::Print()` in `base::Features::Init()` and starting Chrome. There will be only one print of the function.
It's probably desirable for a fix for this to be merged into m125 to avoid some perceived regressions in hold-back experiments.

entry.title: Ctrl+V not working properly on Android devices
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. Connect a keyboard to Android device. Both bluetooth keyboard and otg+wired keyboard are OK. 2. Open a webpage that has textarea on it. For example, https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/textarea 3. Touch or click the textarea to focus on it 4. ### For the following steps, do not use mouse or touchscreen, use only keyboard ### 5. Hold `Shift`, use `arrow keys` to select some text. `Ctrl+C` to copy, use arrow keys to move cursor, then `Ctrl+V` to paste it. This time *maybe* it works. 6. Do step 5 again. Hold `Shift`, use `arrow keys` to select some text. `Ctrl+C` to copy, use arrow keys to move cursor, then `Ctrl+V` to paste it. At this time, `Ctrl+V` NOT WORKING. But if you input some text or touch the textarea, then `Ctrl+V` works.
# Problem Description After copying some text with keyboard only, `Ctrl+V` not working.
Tested with my Android Phone (Redmi K60 Pro, MIUI 14.0.25, Android 13), and Android Tablet (MiPad 5Pro, MIUI 13, Android 11). Both Chrome (v123.0.6312.118, just installed from google play) and Edge has this problem. While Firefox do not. So I think maybe it is a bug of chromium.
# Summary Ctrl+V not working properly on Android devices
# Custom Questions #### Does the problem occur on multiple sites? Yes - Please describe below
#### Is it a problem with a plugin? No - It's the browser itself
#### Does this work in other browsers? Yes - This is just a Chromium problem
# Additional Data Category: Content \ Chrome Channel: Stable \ Regression: N/A

entry.title: VT (0x0b) stripped from XFO/CSP even though only HTTP-/ascii-whitespace should be stripped
entry.content:
Vertical Tabs (0x0b) are interpreted as whitespace for both XFO and CSP even though the specification require ascii-whitespace [CSP](https://w3c.github.io/webappsec-csp/#framework-infrastructure) or HTTP whitespace [XFO](https://fetch.spec.whatwg.org/#http-whitespace) that both do not contain VT.
- Example 1: `CSP: \vframe-ancestors 'none'` [URL](http://sub.headers.websec.saarland/_hp/tests/framing.sub.html?resp_type=parsing&browser_id=1&label=CSP-FA&first_id=6265&last_id=6269&scheme=http&t_resp_id=6269&t_element_relation=iframe_direct&t_resp_origin=https://headers.webappsec.eu) - Example 2: `CSP: img-src\v 'self'`[URL](http://sub.headers.websec.saarland/_hp/tests/subresource-loading-csp.sub.html?resp_type=parsing&browser_id=1&label=CSP-IMG&first_id=29354&last_id=29358&scheme=http&t_resp_id=29354&t_element_relation=iframe_direct&t_resp_origin=https://headers.webappsec.eu) - Example 3: `XFO: DENY\v`[URL](http://sub.headers.websec.saarland/_hp/tests/framing.sub.html?resp_type=parsing&browser_id=1&label=XFO&first_id=3630&last_id=3634&scheme=http&t_resp_id=3633&t_element_relation=iframe_direct&t_resp_origin=https://headers.webappsec.eu)
Safari has the same issue. Firefox does not strip \v and interprets all these examples as invalid.
Probably related: https://issues.chromium.org/issues/334755563

entry.title: Investigate if WebTransport work in WebView out of the box
entry.content:
Web Sockets are behind a weird permission on WebView (`setDomStorageEnabled`). Investigate if WebTransport works out of the box.
https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5442877/comment/af240aa8_6d20baef/

entry.title: Investigate VirtualKeyboard APIs in WebView
entry.content:
The VirtualKeyboard API in WebView has `show` and `hide` methods that don't seem to do anything.
https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5442877/comment/76bb707f_ddfd03d0/

entry.title: The NFC cannot be toggled ON
entry.content: The NFC cannot be toggled ON. No switch for toggling the NFC. No NFC tile in the quick setting.

entry.title: [css-anchor-positioning] Figure out if there's still an issue with ::backdrop
entry.content: This CL showed an issue with ::backdrop, but when I apply the same changes on current main, the issue has somehow vanished. Figure out why. https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5442875/1

entry.title: Refactor PrerenderManager and its tests
entry.content:
At the beginning, PrerenderManager was designed only for 2 triggers. Now more triggers are introduced, resulting in duplicated code and easy-to-miss checks.
Consider refactoring the code and the tests.

entry.title: `git cl archive` hits 404
entry.content:
(artificial) Repro steps: - git new-branch blah - git cl issue 5447539 - git new-branch bleh - git cl archive
Expected: blah is deleted Actual: ``` Finding all branches associated with closed issues... entry.title: WebAssembly speculative inlining of call_indirect
entry.content:
Tracking bug for speculative inlining of call_indirect. We will start with a prototype on x64, Turboshaft-only. Subtasks are: - Increase feedback vector allocation size (which already exists for direct call and speculative call_ref inlining). - Decide how to represent call targets / on what to key the feedback, since unlike for call_ref, there is no funcref object available. - Collect feedback in Liftoff before/at each call_indirect. - Update processing of feedback in `TransitiveTypeFeedbackProcessor` to handle this new kind of feedback. - Extend code generation in Turboshaft to (polymorphically) inline the top (N) caller(s).
Relevant prior documents: - https://docs.google.com/document/d/1jo-Gqn4BieiOFXZp2g06c3u0XO2QriyDbDu-yg2J2M0/edit?usp=sharing&resourcekey=0-z9HEcMo7L9TOnSPvlcxK2w - https://docs.google.com/document/d/1v6B56fmLwzqP8L9nArevChrP2ttruud0uP0gPYAeAOU/edit?usp=sharing

entry.title: Chromium Windows 10 and a free movie site used for some time is no longer available to me or every
entry.content:
# Steps to reproduce the problem 1. link dopebox.to a free movie site 2. rather than block access unless user adds extension then 3. the site initially looks normal as used before then blocks so
# Problem Description Thank you kindly was the first and foremost reason to comment and not about a complaint but something perhaps I have misunderstood as being site that I paid an annual donation for CC & Subtitles mainly. In any event, I appreciate your time. I pay and use several 5 services but there is no reason why the system will block my access? Why?
# Additional Comments Odd that a Google employee looking at my Lexus to purchase showed me a good site to watch movies.at dopebox.to and I simply would like to continue visiting there because I've paid my dues to everyone and their sister. Thank you kindly. .Tell me like you would a six year old. *Margin Call. a movie quote. A guess would be #greed.
# Summary Chromium Windows 10 and a free movie site used for some time is no longer available to me or every
# Custom Questions #### Please select a label to classify your issue: Type-Bug-Regression - Used to work, now broken
# Additional Data Category: Other \ Chrome Channel: Not sure \ Regression: Yes

entry.title: Subset of credit cards offered for 'name' field vs 'number' field
entry.content:
I'm not sure if this issue is new or not, but I don't recall seeing it before and it seems concerning. We should check backwards in time and see if it reproduces historically.
Version: 123.0.6312.124 (also tested on 125.0.6422.0) OS: MacOS (haven't tested others) Websites tested: - https://rsolomakhin.github.io/autofill/ - https://dump-truck.appspot.com/usecase-cc/cc.html
Issue:
When I click into the 'Name' field of the form(s), only one of my three cards is shown. If I click into the 'Number' field, all three cards are shown instead.
Details/Notes:
All three cards are server cards, and they all show up in chrome://settings/payments .
When I visit pay.google.com all three cards do show up, *but* the two that don't appear in the Name field when filling are marked as 'Incomplete card information'. However it's not clear to me what is missing - when I click 'Fix' no field is obviously highlighted as a problem, though there is no address for the two 'incomplete' cards. I can try adding an address to one of those and see if it resolves the issue, though imo it shouldn't require an address for a card to be offered for the Name field?
Screenshots (internal only for semi-privacy, although nothing super sensitive here): - https://screenshot.googleplex.com/58hEqXsHfSsReUN.png - https://screenshot.googleplex.com/3duYiHRWKZexxgW.png

entry.title: Remove RAW_PTR_EXCLUSION for 'url_formatter::IDNSpoofChecker::HuffmanTrieParams::trie'
entry.content:
## Overview
This field is excluded from our automatic rewrite to `raw_ptr<T>` and not protected by MiraclePtr. To increase UaF protection coverage, we need to manually rewrite this pointer to `raw_ptr<T>`.
- identifier: `url_formatter::IDNSpoofChecker::HuffmanTrieParams::trie` - code location: [components/url_formatter/spoof_checks/idn_spoof_checker.h:74:5](https://source.chromium.org/search?q=components%2Furl_formatter%2Fspoof_checks%2Fidn_spoof_checker.h%3A74%3A5) - exclusion taxonomy: `#global-scope`
The location may be outdated if the file is updated recently.

entry.title: Regression : Show shortcuts toggle UI is improper in Customise Chrome
entry.content:
Chrome Version: 125.0.6422.0 (Official Build) canary (arm64) 6587a06b3703f8c7ac270c7c7f3efcd395860bfa-refs/branch-heads/6422@{#1}
OS : Mac,Linux
Preconditions: #force-ui-direction - Enabled - Right-To-Left
Steps to reproduce: 1. Launch chrome and enable RTL flag as mentioned above 2. Open NTP and click on Customise Chrome 3. Observe Show shortcuts toggle
Actual Result: Toggle UI is not proper
Expected Result: Toggle UI must be proper
Please find bisect info below:
This is a regression issue broken in M125, and please find per revision-bisect info below:
Good Build : 125.0.6421.0 Bad Build : 125.0.6422.0
You are probably looking for a change made after 1287537 (known good), but no later than 1287538 (first known bad).
CHANGELOG URL:
The script might not always return single CL as suspect as some perf builds might get missing due to failure.
https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+log/462e5bba7f6feb8d298788f0e8f1bfb1968676fa..9cf8470fb17337e7af959d879a243ec4dbea3308
Suspect: https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/9cf8470fb17337e7af959d879a243ec4dbea3308
@John Lee: Could you please check whether this is caused with respect to your change, if not please help us in assigning it to the right owner.
Note 1.Issue repro on latest Canary #125.0.6422.0 2.Issue not repro on latest Dev #125.0.6420.3, Beta #124.0.6367.60 and Stable #124.0.6367.61 3.Issue is reproducible on Linux.
Kindly refer the screencasts attached below
Good Build : https://screenshot.googleplex.com/TbkyWrKWzT6aSiT.png
Bad Build : https://screenshot.googleplex.com/T4i4RKjZphfNxyD.png
Thanks!

entry.title: Tests are failing: java.lang.NullPointerException: Attempt to invoke virtual method 'org.chromium.chrome.browser.omnibox.UrlBarData org.chromium.chrome.browser.omnibo...
entry.content:
This bug is for all test failures where the primary error message is similiar to the following (ignoring numbers and hexadecimal values): java.lang.NullPointerException: Attempt to invoke virtual method 'org.chromium.chrome.browser.omnibox.UrlBarData org.chromium.chrome.browser.omnibox.UrlBarCoordinator.getUrlBarData()' on a null object reference
The following test(s) were observed to have matching failures at this time (at most five examples listed): - ninja://chrome/android:chrome_public_test_apk/org.chromium.chrome.browser.media.ui.FullscreenVideoPictureInPictureControllerTest#testEnterPip - ninja://chrome/android:chrome_public_test_apk/org.chromium.chrome.browser.media.ui.FullscreenVideoPictureInPictureControllerTest#testExitPipWhenDeviceLocked - ninja://chrome/android:chrome_public_test_apk/org.chromium.chrome.browser.media.ui.FullscreenVideoPictureInPictureControllerTest#testExitOnCloseTab - ninja://chrome/android:chrome_public_test_apk/org.chromium.chrome.browser.media.ui.FullscreenVideoPictureInPictureControllerTest#testExitOnLeaveFullscreen - ninja://chrome/android:chrome_public_test_apk/org.chromium.chrome.browser.media.ui.FullscreenVideoPictureInPictureControllerTest#testExitPipOnNavigation
These test failures are causing problem(s) which require your attention, including: - many gardened builders are failing
See current problems, failure examples and more in LUCI Analysis at: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/p/chromium/rules/ef86393c5e1c52cac581248aeade7d67
How to action this bug: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#new-bug-filed Provide feedback: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#feedback Was this bug filed in the wrong component? See: https://luci-analysis.appspot.com/help#component-selection
